DOC.HEAD: With PM-Panama Military
DOC.TEXT: The various military divisions that took part in ``Operation Just Cause,'' the U.S. force that invaded Panama, include: _Task Force Atlantic: This consisted of an Army battalion from the 7th Infantry Division and a battalion from the 82nd Airborne Division, which was in the Jungle Operations Training Center in Panama. Atlantic's mission was to secure several critical sites in the Atlantic-Caribbean side of Panama. Troops also took control of the prison at Gamboa. _Task Force Semper Fidelis: This was made up of a Marine rifle company and a light armored infantry company; Marines as well as additional military police. Semper Fidelis secured the Bridge of the Americas and ensured the security of Howard Air Force Base and its environs. _Task Force Red: This consisted of an Army Ranger battalion that parachuted into Panama. Their mission was to take over the international airfield, preparing it for forces from the 82nd Airborne to land. They were assisted by Special Forces units assigned to Panama's Southern Command. _Task Force Bayonet: This consisted of a battalion from the Army's 6th Mechanized Division. It was supported by a platoon of light tanks as well as the 5th battalion of the Army's 87th Infantry. Bayonet provided security in Panama City's central section and the mechanized battalion seized the Comandancia, the headquarters of the Panamanian Defense Forces.
